intro: Euphrasia picta subsp. arguta, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
